result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew George Matteson

records.addlTxt: 8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew George Matteson appeared by video, in custody by video from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by video for Matthew George Matteson. Witness unavailable. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Defense argues for bond modification, State objects with argument. Court denies modification.
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew George Matteson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson appeared by Taylor Klokow by video for Matthew George Matteson. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 8:30.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:50 PM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew George Matteson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Matthew George Matteson. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $250.00 with conditions: Absolute Sobriety. No contact with Officer Seuferer. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 3PM
Absolute Sobriety. No contact with Officer Seuferer
